tldr: The author examines a recently discovered Maya calendar inscription and uses calendar tables created by J. T. Goodman to interpret it. They discuss the Maya's system of time divisions, including the Great Cycle, Katun, Ahau, Chuen, and the annual calendar. The author explains how to read and understand the dates and time periods in the inscription, providing insights into the Maya's complex and sophisticated understanding of time.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Archaeology
